newsitem.title: USA: Florida jobless rate unchanged at 4.9 pct in March.
newsitem.headline: Florida jobless rate unchanged at 4.9 pct in March.

text.p: Florida's unemployment rate was 4.9 percent in March, unchanged from February, the state Department of Labor and Employment Security said.
Total nonfarm employment increased by 182,300 jobs or 2.9 over March of last year, reaching 6.4 million.

Services added the most jobs over the year, 101,400, and had the fastest growth rate, 4.8 percent. Construction grew by 3,800 jobs or 1.2 percent over the year but remaind far below the 1988-89 peak after four years of slow growth.
Trade grew by 58,800 jobs or 3.7 percent over the year while manufacturing added 3,100 jobs over the year for a 0.6 perent growth rate.
Transportation, communications and public utilities added 9,800 jobs and grew 3.1 percent over the year. Finance, insurance and real estate grew by 14,400 jobs or 3.7 percent over the year.
Government was the only sector to lose jobs, shrinking by 9,100 jobs or 0.9 percent over the year. All the losses were in local government.

Monroe County had the lowest unemployment rate, 2.1 percent, and Hardee County had the highest, 12.5 percent. Among the state's 67 counties, 49 had decreases in their unemployment rates from year-ago levels.

All of the metropolitan areas had over-the-year increases. Orlando added the most jobs, 41,600 and had the fastest growth rate, 5.6 percent. Miami added the fewest jobs, 14,700 and had the slowest growth rate, 1.6 percent.
